task.title: Viewing cluster information by using the
task.shortdesc: Use the cluster status view to see statistics about the cluster, the cluster members, and messaging activity between this server and the remote cluster members.

context.p: You can view cluster and cluster member statistics by using the , or by using . For more information about using a to view connection monitor statistics, see .

step.cmd: From the , navigate to the Cluster Status page by selecting Cluster Status .

choice.p: To view information about the rate of message throughput for the server on which you are viewing cluster monitoring statistics, complete the following step:

ol.li:
From the Cluster Status page, go to the Throughput Chart pane.
The Throughput Chart displays the rate of message traffic into and from the cluster:
Local incoming and outgoing rates relate to messages that are received from or sent to messaging client applications (MQTT or JMS applications).
Remote incoming and outgoing rates relate to messages that are received from or sent to other servers in the cluster

choices.choice:
To view information about the cluster status of the cluster member on which you are viewing cluster monitoring statistics, complete the following step:
From the Cluster Status page, go to the Cluster Status Data pane.
The cluster information about the server on which you are viewing the cluster monitoring statistics is displayed.

To view information about the other cluster members, complete the following step:
From the Cluster Status page, go to the Cluster Status Data pane and view the cluster member table.
For details about the data presented in the table, see .
Optional. By clicking on a cluster member in the first column of the table, you can start to manage that cluster member. If the server is already in the list of servers that are administered by the , the link takes you to the cluster status page of that server. If the server is not in the list of servers that are administered by the , you are prompted to provide configuration information for the other cluster member before you can start to manage it.
